alert.note: Alert for Lee (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 30 at 5:48PM EDT until July 31 at 10:24AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Kentucky River at Heidelberg affecting Lee County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kentucky River at Heidelberg. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 22.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:45 PM EDT Saturday was 25.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling to 13.1 feet Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.0 feet on 03/07/1923. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. The next statement will be issued by 6 AM Sunday.
